comment: This professor assigns assignment one day in advance and doesn't provide clear instructions. If you can avoid this professors at all costs then do it because you will be confused the whole time and she's really bad at answering emails.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Bhasin has probably been one of the best professors I've ever had. She very VERY clearly is very invested in the material and a lot of times her enthusiasm was a bit infectious. She also seemed genuinely invested in my success and went out of her way to make sure I was accommodated and set up for success.

Well, Dr. Bhasin is very knowledgeable. She is an expert in her field. With that being said, her instructions for the discussions are not very clear at times. She is a slow grader. The exams and homework are tough even with heavy studying. You really need to put in the work to do well in this class. TONS of reading!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Literally one of the worst professors I have ever had, by far. She assigns way too much work that she cannot keep up. Class has been over for a few days and 3 assignments still have not been graded. She does not respond to emails & her assignments are unorganized and confusing with unclear instructions. Avoid taking any of her classes if possible!

It's 2 days before final grades are due, and there are four assignments in this course that have not been graded. She acknowledged her lateness in grading 10 days ago and promised to grade the remaining assignments last week so that we could revise for better credit, but the class has been over for days with no sign of grades. She assigns too much.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Want to never know how youre doing in your class? Want a professor who grades half your assignments in the term less than a day before theyre due? This is the professor for you! She only responds to about half the students emails and is MIA the majority of the time. Didnt even know I was going to get an A because I didnt have anything graded.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is very slow to respond to email (if she responds) and graded 6 assignments the day final grades were due. She opened a channel on Teams to give feedback on an assignment and when the appropriate changes were made to that assignment, she docked points for items she had not critiqued prior.

I have taken profesor a basin twice; most recently over the summer. Both times it has taken a while to get grades back. Projects and papers are graded tough. Shes a very intelligent women and I respect her a lot but it has been really hard to get an A in her class.

Professor Bhasin's class was interesting. We had quizzes every week, but all the answers are on quizlet. Be prepared to read A LOT, as she assigns long take home readings. Tests were hard, but manageable. Study the quizzes and lecture powerpoints for tests. One paper that had to be written in Chicago Style. Definitely participate in discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Listen to all of the other ratings and take her at no cost. She was awful, she grades papers with no type of logic you can do literally 2 identical assignments and get an a and an f. Theres 3 discussions and a quiz every week. Test heavy she gives you like an hour to complete 50 questions. No curves no mercy nothing and she barely communicates.

I was very hesitant about taking this professor because of all the negative reviews she has. Professor Bhasin is not bad. The three discussion posts are kinda annoying but they are doable. If you read her instructions, you should be fine.

Do not take Professor Bhasin if you are looking for an A. I do not recommend taking her online. She is impossible to get in contact with, she has no rhyme or reason for how she grades. If you ask her for feedback she will simply tell you to look at the rubric and often times the graded rubric is not accurate.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I am currently taking the online course and theres way too much to do on a weekly basis (3 discussion posts and a quiz every week) theres very vague instructions and grading depends on her mood she can give you an A for doing the same thing as something shell give you a C for.

This was the worst class I've taken. She makes it hard just to make it hard. There is little feedback. 3 discussion posts a week one due tues, thurs, & sat. These discussion posts are like small essays. She grades them very strictly and expects a TON of detail and information. Quizes weekly are ok. Exams are a nightmare. 60 questions in 60 minutes.

Dr. Bhasin was an amazing professor! I went into this class thinking it was going to be so hard because of the reviews, but it honestly wasn't. The only reason I did not make an A is because of my own fault of missing deadlines, nothing having to do w/the prof! She also responds quickly to emails and despite one review, she is very clear. Love her!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: NOT a fan. She was so vague on what she wanted done on the assignments. She did not grade until weeks after and then she would make one post about how we all did it wrong. She did not answer my emails promptly when I addressed her. She was difficult and complicated. If she would have answered my questions I could have easily gotten a better grade..
Awful online professor, Do not take her

Sends you information for the entire semester in the first week. Afterwards, didn't hear anything, including grades, from professor for weeks after assignments were turned in. Grades updated several weeks after assignments are due so it's impossible to know what you are doing wrong until several weeks into the semester. Would NOT recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor is not one to take for an online course. She is very disorganized and vague in how she wants assignments done. She is also very biased so conservatives beware. She makes you pull your discussion posts from extremely liberal news sites and is not fair in grading your papers. AVOID!!!

I really enjoyed this comparative politics course this past spring. Although I didn't make an A, as I would have liked, earning a B made me proud because the class was not easy and I enjoyed the challenge and critical thinking aspect. (I work full time and took 4 courses this past spring) I learned a lot. Not for the student looking for an easy A.

Easily one of the worst professors I've ever had. She's extremely biased, confusing, and not clear about assignments. She expects you to participate in a "group discussion" each week (which is just answering her assigned questions) and although you can see everyone's answers, she expects you to come up with something different. in a class of 35ish

I hated this class. Her online discussions were completely butchered. It was hard to keep track, multiple errors in some discussions. Some weren't even open the week they were meant for. Her syllabus is completely vague and it seems she was too lazy to change it for her online class. To top it off I got 1 hour for a 60 question Final, do not take!
I made all A's this semester, except for this class. She was by far the hardest teacher Ive ever had. She gives exams that are un-neccesarily hard, and her papers are graded harshly.

I should have avoided her like the comments said. Her syllabus is completely confusing, and I don't think she even understands it. Add to that a TA who seems to be the only one teaching. What a waste.

I definitely had my fears going into this class ... but I learned more in this class than I could have ever imagined. Dr. Bhasin cares for her students. She is passionate and here for the right reasons. The class isn't easy by any means, but get to know her-- it will make the difference!

Pros: she is passionate about teaching, she ACTUALLY teaches instead of just regurgitating the book Cons: she grades her assignments based on a scale in her head and not on her OWN instructions so grading is a hit or miss, also acts like she has something to prove - so tests or hw are sometimes easy or hard.  She's not predictable.

AVOID!!!!! She is not part of the course at all. Does not respond to emails until way after the fact. Does not assist or offer clarification. Her essays are bogus. She does not explain what they're asking and will give no credit for you not being able to read her mind. I almost failed her class over 7 essays questions when all else was A material.

bhasin has great enthusiasm for politics.. thats where the positives end. she has no standard grading rubric for essays (the process is completely vague/arbitrary). when asked if errors could have been made on grading.. she said it was impossible. some of the most learned people i know lack common sense, bhasin included. AVOID

Attendance mandatory!!  She is a great person, The lectures topics are dry but she makes her best for people to get engage. Homework assignments can be hard but the online exams are not hard at all.  Highly reccomended class!!

Dr. Bhasin has a teaching style that requires your to be prepared for class by reading the material assigned in the sylabus. This is no different than any other class. I do agree with other comments about how vague the class project instructions are; however, Dr. Bhasin goes out of her way to make time to explain them to you.

Class discussion and examples very interesting. Homework is multiple choice (but tricky sometimes), mid term and final are multiple choice/short answer and all testing is completed online. The group project instructions can be difficult to understand, but she is ALWAYS available for clarification. You do not need the EXPENSIVE book.

Dr. Bhasin does the best she can to make research methods more interesting. It's a very dull class no matter who teaches it. She is very nice and really cares about her students. You don't need the book.

Dr. Bhasin is different from most other professors. All the complaining about her is from people who expect to be taught, rather than wanting to learn. Go to class, pay attention, and participate and you will make an easy A.

She has a very confusing method of teaching. Tests are deliberately hard and meant to confuse you. Her grading system is very unfair. Avoid this  class if you want to maintain your grade point average. Even if you do everything as required well,your grade will probably be 1-2 letter grades below what you calculate your grade to be.

Professor Bhasin is a hard person. Her lectures will lull you to sleep, her homework is confusing, and her grading system is ridiculous. She require a one page essay question per exam, four short paragraph answers, and 40 multiple choice questions. You will have two exams that are worth 30% each, and ten HWs worth 30%and 10% mandatory attendance.No
Best instructor ever!!
Don't take this class
VERY SMART, AND WILLING TO WORK WITH THE STUDENTS.

Horrible! I really enjoyed her class and thought I was destined for an A. However though her sketchy grading I ended up with a low B. This is still a mystery to me as I got an A on almost everything and followed her exact example on my paper. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!

Took 2280 with bhasin and found the class ok. Enjoyed the class but found her grading and feedback unjust and everything but reliable. The tests are relatively easy but homeworks should follow her instructions meticulously..
She's great! Very interesting!

AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL! She is AWFUL! I got A's on EVERYTHING but bc i missed 4 classes, and i did not talk in class i got a D! SHE IS AWFUL, she teaches in a WERID way, her tests are AWFUL, 7 or 8 multiple choices! its AWFUL...

I took 4436 over the summer. One discussion board a week all essay test and a ten page paper. If you read the material and do the discussion boards you will at least get a B. She is very understanding and the class is actually interesting.
